content.description: There is nice stone on this one. Climb out of the west-facing pit. SDS on the big, flat edge, and move straight up the face on awesome crimps, sidepulls, and edges not using either arete.
content.protection: Pads, hanging a pad on the boulder behind will save one from the back slapper ledge.
content.location: Climb out of the pit at the Upper Deck starting on the ledge.

content.description: Shadowplay is a neat problem climbing out of the overhang that is just above the Practice block. A great setting and the exposure makes it feel a bit airy. Frog start on the obvious edge, and move up through edges and pockets up the overhanging shadowy side of the boulder.
content.protection: Pads. A spotter will give peace of mind but is not necessary.
content.location: Go to the Project Block, just before the boulder, cut back west, and wind up on a ledge that is on the top of the Project Block. Shadowplay will be obvious.
